headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?
summary: Technology stocks were driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks were spared from the downturn.  Microsoft was the biggest reason U.S. stocks were down.  Microsoft fell 10% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

raw.headline: Why Was the Market Down Today?
raw.summary: Technology stocks were driving market benchmarks lower Thursday, but many sectors and stocks were spared from the downturn.  Microsoft was the biggest reason U.S. stocks were down.  Microsoft fell 10% after investors raised worries about the company's cloud-business revenue.

headline: IBM Kicks Off Big Tech Bond Sales
summary: IBM is poised to borrow nearly $7.5 billion in the corporate bond market, kicking off what is expected to be a flood of borrowing from the tech sector in 2026. Bloomberg's Ronan Martin and Robert Schiffman from Bloomberg Intelligence discuss the story on "Bloomberg Markets" with Scarlet Fu.

headline: IBM (IBM) Stock Is Up, What You Need To Know
summary: Shares of technology and consulting giant IBM (NYSE:IBM) jumped 3.6% in the afternoon session after the company reported fourth-quarter results that beat Wall Street estimates and offered a strong financial outlook for the upcoming year. The technology and consulting giant's revenue grew 12.1% year-over-year to $19.69 billion, while its adjusted earnings of $4.52 per share also topped expectations. headline: IBM Showcases New Vision for Quantum. How Nvidia and AMD Fit in the Computing Future.
summary: It might seem natural to pit the capabilities of quantum computers—often touted as the next big technology—against today’s supercomputers.  Rather than outright replacing classical machines, quantum systems will likely be built on top of existing architecture to enable more powerful computations.  This perspective was captured in new research from  International Business Machines  which showed how classical graphics processing units, or GPUs, from leading chip makers could work alongside quantum processors to execute problems faster.

raw.headline: IBM Showcases New Vision for Quantum. How Nvidia and AMD Fit in the Computing Future.
raw.summary: It might seem natural to pit the capabilities of quantum computers—often touted as the next big technology—against today’s supercomputers.  Rather than outright replacing classical machines, quantum systems will likely be built on top of existing architecture to enable more powerful computations.  This perspective was captured in new research from  International Business Machines  which showed how classical graphics processing units, or GPUs, from leading chip makers could work alongside quantum processors to execute problems faster.
